Planned Giving/Legacy Society Annual Appeal Contact Us Select Page Exhibition Calendar Keeping it Cool (Call to Artists) Intake July 31, 2025 10am-Noon August 4-September 30, 2025 La Petite Galerie: ( August) JeanCamposano: August 4-September 2, 2025 (September) Sir Roland Richardson September 8-30, 2025 Receptions August 12, 2025 and September 9, 2025 5:30pm-7pm Words as Art October 5- November 24, 2025 “Words as Art” is an innovative exhibition presented by Dpi-Sig Naples, showcasing a fusion of photography and AI-enhanced artwork. This exhibit explores the intersection of visual storytelling and artificial intelligence, highlighting how technology can transform traditional photographic art into dynamic, thought-provoking pieces. Visitors can expect to experience a diverse range of works that challenge perceptions and invite deeper contemplation on the role of AI in contemporary art. The exhibition underscores Dpi-Sig Naples’ commitment to embracing technological advancements while celebrating the art of photography. Gallery Receptions October 14, 2025 (5:30pm-7pm) and November 11, 2025 (5:30pm-7pm) La Petite Galerie: ( October) Pat Howard-October 6-28, 2025 (November) Ron Orlando- November 3, 2025-December 2, 2025 Day of the Dead (grass wall outdoor installation) October 13- November 14, 2025 This outdoor installation in the Art Center courtyard is part of ¡Arte Viva! Now You Know: Arts org to roast city manager; city seeks applicants News Sports Life Opinion Entertainment Obituaries eNewspaper Legals Subscribe LOCAL Now You Know: Arts org to roast Marco city manager; city seeks audit applicants, more Will Watts Special to the Eagle Marco Island Center for the Arts is inviting the community to “an evening of humor, heart, and hometown celebration” during the 70th Birthday Roast of City Manager Mike McNees at 5:30 p.m., Saturday, May 31at the Arts Center Theatre in Marco Town Center. Honorary Roast Master is Hyla Crane, executive director of Marco Island Center for the Arts. The roast will feature friends, coworkers and public figures “sharing their favorite funny moments and stories about McNees, all in the spirit of good-natured fun and community pride.” Roasters include Assistant City Manager Casey Lucius, Director of Community Affairs Dan Smith, Delores Siegel, vice-chair, Parks & Recreation Advisory Committee; Maria Lamb, vice-chair, Beach & Coastal Resources Advisory Committee; longtime friend Joe Townsend, wife Hazel McNees, former City Council chair Jared Grifoni and former City Council member Becky Irwin. “This event showcases the incredible community spirit that defines Marco Island,” said Crane. “It’s a chance to honor Mike’s leadership with laughter while supporting cultural programs that benefit us all.” Tickets are $25, and seating is first come, first served. All proceeds support Marco Island Center for the Arts. Tickets and additional information are available at marcoislandart.org or by calling 239-394-4221. Marco Island seeks applicants for the Audit Advisory Committee The city clerk is accepting applications for potential candidates to fill seats on the Audit Committee through Wednesday. To qualify, individuals must be residents and registered voters of the city. Appointed individuals will be expected to attend year-round meetings, contribute to group discussions, conduct research and prepare reports. You can either apply through  the online application at cityofmarcoisland.com/bc/webform/online-advisory-board-application or submit a paper application available at City Hall, 50 Bald Eagle Dr, Marco Island. While a resume is not mandatory, it is highly recommended that candidates submit one with the application. For assistance or more information, contact City Clerk Joan Taylor at 239-389-5010 or jtaylor@cityofmarcoisland.com . Volunteers ‘Keep Collier Beautiful’ According to Keep Collier Beautiful, over 900 volunteers cleaned up litter and debris for the 2025 Great American Cleanup. This event saw a 76% increase in volunteers, from 514 to 908 registrations, compared to last year. “We typically only get this much traffic during our September cleanup, so this is a huge milestone!” reads their monthly newsletter. Through this jump in volunteers, the amount of trash bags filled and waste collected also increased by 82%. AAUW-Marco Island scholarships awarded The Marco Island Branch of the American Association of University Women held its annual scholarship luncheon on April 14, according to Jackie Childress. Following a successful fundraiser, scholarships of $2,000 each were awarded to four. They are Carla Melendez, Sophia Torres, Brittany Piersma and Josephine Torres. Additionally, $2,000 each was awarded to four high school seniors: Vania Antonio-Cavvillo, Stephanie Escobedo Ochoa, Michelle Acosta and Brigid O’Sullivan. In addition, AAUW provided a grant of $1,500 to the Big Cypress National Reserve “to help in their efforts to educate Collier County’s youth about the important environment in South Florida through their SWAMP 6th grade program,” and sponsored Julissa Ramos, Manatee Middle School, to attend a weeklong Tech Trek STEM Camp at FAU. If you have an interest in joining the Marco Island Branch of AAUW, contact Lyn Maggio, Director for Membership, linda.maggio@gmail.com , for more information. Or visit marcoisland-fl.aauw.net. More: Now You Know: Picture perfect owls; ‘Famlet’ and family chaos on Marco stage And: Goodbye snowbirds! This season, join us for “Oh What a Night: Dinner and a Show,” a captivating evening designed to delight and inspire, set for Saturday, February 15, 2025, at the Island Country Club. Reimagined by our dedicated chairpersons, Donald and Christine Koppel and Stanley and Cynthia Springer, this year’s event promises to be a spectacular blend of entertainment and elegance. In addition to enjoying a sensational performance by “The Modern Gentlemen,” guests will indulge in exquisite cuisine, bid on prized auction items and experiences, and dance the night away. This evening will also honor the contributions of beloved Art Center supporters Michael and Vicki Hook. Event Highlights: - Entertainment by “The Modern Gentlemen”: More than a decade singing alongside the legendary Frankie Valli, these “four seasoned” outstanding vocalists formed The Modern Gentlemen. Known for their harmonious renditions of Frankie Valli and The Four Seasons, Motown, doo-wop, and other timeless tunes, The Modern Gentlemen bring a fresh twist to beloved melodies. Frankie Valli himself has lauded them, saying, “These guys are truly special! They’re the BEST singers I’ve ever worked with!” - Delicious Cuisine: Savor a gourmet dinner prepared by the chefs at Island Country Club, designed to complement the evening’s entertainment. - Auction Opportunities: Bid on exclusive items and experiences during our lively auction, supporting the Marco Island Center for the Arts. - Dancing and More: Enjoy an evening of dancing and celebration in a setting that redefines the traditional gala experience. The Marco Island Center for the Arts is committed to enhancing the cultural fabric of our community, and this event is a vital part of our mission. All proceeds from “Oh What a Night: Dinner and a Show” will support our ongoing programs and initiatives. Tickets and Sponsorship: Tickets for this memorable evening will be available for purchase soon. For sponsorship opportunities or additional information, please contact the Marco Island Center for the Arts at 239-394-4221 or visit our website at https://www.marcoislandart.org/annual-gala/ Join us for a night to remember as we celebrate the arts and community in style! Planned Giving/Legacy Society Annual Appeal Contact Us Select Page Click Here for Festival Of Trees Submission Information Become a “Decorator” for the Marco Island Center for the Arts 2025 Festival of Trees Marco Island Center for the Arts is looking for creative individuals, businesses, groups, and organizations to help increase the holiday spirit by decorating a tree for the Art Center’s annual Festival of Trees. The Festival of Trees is a holiday event at Marco Island Center for the Arts and dollars raised benefit the nonprofit’s classes for children and adults, and art exhibitions and events. Founded in 2014 by dedicated Marco Island volunteer and art supporter Mr. Dave Rice, the Festival of Trees is a fundraising and community goodwill event. The 11th annual Festival of Trees is December 2– December 5. The Festival offers students, individuals, families, businesses, clubs, and organizations a unique opportunity to participate in this annual holiday fundraiser. “We are excited to have people showcase their creative talent, providing a beautiful atmosphere for families that consider the Festival of Trees the official start to the holiday season” said Dave Rice, Festival of Trees Founder. How it Works Three foot trees or smaller can be decorated with any style or theme you choose, so let your imagination run wild! Tree decorators will be responsible for providing a tree and all lighting and decorating materials. Electrical outlets are available. A limited number of spaces are available. Register early. There is no registration fee! Registration forms are available at the Art Center or can be downloaded at www.marcoislandart.org There will be a silent auction for the trees. This is a joint fundraising effort with the decorator and Marco Island Center for the Arts. Each will receive 50% of the net proceeds. You can also elect to donate 100% of the proceeds to Marco Island Center for the Arts. Visitors will be able to vote for their favorite tree. The People’s Choice Award will be announced on December 4, 2025. 2025 Festival of Trees Schedule: November 24   FINAL DAY to Submit Registration Forms. DUE BY: 4 pm December 1   9:00 am – 4:00 pm  Installation of the trees December 2 -December 4 9:00 am – 4:00 pm  Festival of the Trees and Tree Silent Auction December 4 4:00 pm -Silent Auction Closes/Winners Notified December 5 9:00 am – 4:00 pm Tree pick up. All trees must be paid for and picked up. Unsold trees must also be picked up by the Tree Decorator. Please return registration form to Marco Island Center for the Arts, 1010 Winterberry Dr. Marco Island or email to info @marcoislandart.org. Questions? Planned Giving/Legacy Society Annual Appeal Contact Us Select Page THE GREAT CREATE BE AN ARTIST AT MARCO ISLAND CENTER FOR THE ARTS Take your group on a journey into the world of fine arts at Marco Island Center for the Arts, and join one of the world’s foremost mixed media artists, Marjorie Pesek, in creating your own fine art masterpiece. Pesek will share the technique that has garnered her placement in private and gallery collections in the United States and in Europe. This layered imagery technique offers group members the opportunity to capture their inner artists, tell a story and create a masterpiece-regardless of their level of artistic skill. Prepare to be moved by this opportunity to generate your own portrait of this memorable experience in the fine arts world. Please submit your date interest in the form below or call 239-394-4221 and ask for Patricia Mills. January 25, 2022 10am-12:30 March 22, 2022 10am-12:30 May 24, 2022 10am-12:30 COST: $70 per person DETAILS: • No prior art knowledge is necessary • No prior art knowledge is necessary • Booking required in advance • Ideal for groups of 10-15 DURATION: 2.5 hours FOR BOOKING AND MORE INFORMATION Fill OUT THE FORM BELOW Notice: JavaScript is required for this content. Planned Giving/Legacy Society Annual Appeal Contact Us Select Page MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival Marco Island Center for the Arts 1010 Winterberry Drive, Marco Island 05 oct 5:30 pm MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival Event Details We are proud to announce that we are partnering with MANHATTAN SHORT and bringing the 26th Annual MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival to Marco Island Center for the Arts and Arts Event Details We are proud to announce that we are partnering with MANHATTAN SHORT and bringing the 26 th Annual MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival to Marco Island Center for the Arts and Arts Center Theatre in October, 2023. MANHATTAN SHORT was started in September, 1998, by Nicholas Mason. Nicholas mounted a screen to the side of a truck on Mulberry St. in New York City and projected 16 short films to a crowd of around 300 New Yorkers, who watched from the street. From that first showing, MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival has grown to over 100,000 film lovers in over 500 cities across six continents who gather for one reason…to view and vote on the Finalists’ Films in the 26th Annual MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival. MANHATTAN SHORT is not a touring Festival; rather, it is an instantaneous celebration that occurs simultaneously across the globe, bringing great films to great venues and allowing the audiences to select their favorites. The Film Festival experience is about getting great works in front of as many eyes as possible, and MANHATTAN SHORT offers the truly ultimate platform — one that sees its films screened in Sydney, Mumbai, Moscow, Vienna, and Cape Town, to cinemas in all fifty states of the United States and beyond. This year we are extremely excited to be bringing this Film Festival to Marco Island and giving S.W. Florida a chance to vote on a potential 2024 Oscar winning Short Film, as every film selected for MANHATTAN SHORT is automatically qualified for the 2024 Oscars. We have two dates that we will be showing the MANHATTAN SHORT films, Thursday, October 5, 2023, at 5:30 PM, and Sunday, October 8, 2023 at 3:00 PM. Tickets can be purchased on our website www.marcoislandart.org and are $10 for Art Center members and $15 for non-members. YOU GET TO BE THE JUDGE! Upon entry at all participating venues, festival attendees are handed a Voting Card and an Official Program and asked to vote for the ONE Film and Actor they feel should win. Votes are tallied by each host venue then emailed to our NYC headquarters. Please join us at Marco Island Center for the Arts at 1010 Winterberry Dr., Marco Island, FL and be a part of ONE WORLD – ONE WEEK – ONE FESTIVAL – The 26th Annual MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival! more Time October 5, 2023 5:30 pm (GMT-04:00) Location Marco Island Center for the Arts 1010 Winterberry Drive, Marco Island Other Events Calendar GoogleCal Purchase Tickets Tickets are not available for sale any more for this event!
